info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 9:37PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SLIPPERY ROAD CONDITIONS LIKELY THROUGH MONDAY MORNING DUE TO THE RECENT SNOWFALL AND COLD TEMPERATURES... A dusting to a couple of inches of snow affected many locations in the northern North Carolina mountains over the past 24 hours. The snow showers are ending late Sunday evening, but temperatures are expected to fall well down into the 20s overnight as cold high pressure builds across the mountains. This will lead to continued slippery road conditions across the region. If traveling overnight through Monday morning, allow extra travel time and use caution while driving. Any snow covered roadways will be very slippery, and black ice on road surfaces can be difficult to spot.
